item.title: Blocked residential road and car park, 24th August
item.description:
The residential road (Harton Street) is being obstructed by makeshift barriers preventing residents from parking. In addition, portable toilets are occupying parking spaces, and a makeshift tent has been set up in the car park, blocking around 70% of the available spaces. These actions are severely reducing residents‚Äô access to necessary parking.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harton Street, Deptford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Paving slabs broken and lifted, 24th August
item.description:
Paving is broken and lifting around the base of the tree. It is a tripping hazard and dangerous for partially sighted people or with other disabilities. The problem has been there for some time. It‚Äôs at tte junction with willow grove and entrance to Sainsbury‚Äôs car park

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Willow Grove, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bushes overhang the footpath, 24th August
item.description:
The bushes along the pathways are consistently overgrown. This issue persists due to a lack of maintenance, particularly since this path is frequently used during rainy weather. The branches are so thick that it's nearly impossible to walk without constantly bending down. They've grown so long that my daughter has to duck frequently just to get through. This is a significant concern, especially for her, as she relies on this footpath to visit us. Being partially sighted, she struggles to see the overhanging branches, which creates a safety hazard for anyone using the path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 224, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Berry tree not maintained, 24th August
item.description:
Garden is smothered in fallen berries/seeds, making the surface slippery for tenants would there be any chance of having the trees lopped / cut to reduce the amount of berries/seeds falling on my garden , also had to have trees cut my self before due to this hazard my grandaughter ended eating berries as well very dangerous she ended up in hospital , the trees in question are in your private land but hang right over in my garden , we even had replace trellis due to this matter where it broke , tress are not maintained at all I had to get a work man my self to do a quick cut few time now. I reported this matter serval time could this be addressed please as there dangerous to eat and very slippery , it on garden fence down side where green space is

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haven Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet
